title: How did LGBT community meet each other back in the 50's and 60's? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the days before the Stonewall Riots, there were several methods of clandestine communication. My favorite was the system of colored pocket squares. They not only told people you were gay, but what you were into. Also, certain bars and bath houses developed a reputation for catering to “those people”. Nobody talked about it, but everyone knew.
With the exception of social media, I would assume they met each other in the same places they meet them today. it's not like we have special meeting houses for members of the LGBT community.
